text: Hello! I am trying to get my local dev environment set up. I followed the instructions here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-local-development>, but on step 2, my YAML file is not in the current working directory. It ends up in /Users/<me>/HubSpot.config.yaml. Is this correct? The docs say, "Once you've completed this simple init flow, you'll see a success message confirming that a configuration file, HubSpot.config.yml, has been created *in your current directory.*"

Sorry yes we made a change to place it in your user folder and are planning to change it back. It is fine for the file to be there, the important part is that the config file is either in the current directory or a parent directory of the current directory. If you prefer to put it in the current directory you may move it, but you dont need to, it will work either way.

Sorry for the confusion.

Where can I get a comprehensive overview/tutorial on the HubSpot CMS? I'm finding parts of documentation and videos, but I'm still trying to understand the big picture. I'm an experienced dev, but new to the HubSpot CMS. I'm working for a company that uses it and I've inherited the projet. Where should I start?
I'd love a tutorial on how to create a new theme from scratch or something similar.

This is a great starting point for you then. This is a high level overview of how it all works and fits together. The getting started tutorial linked at the top of this page will also give you a quick glimpse of what its like to build on the CMS. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/key-concepts|https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/key-concepts>

This tutorial will show you how to create a theme starting from our boilerplate which is a bare bones theme you can use to start from or use as a reference to build your own.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-themes|https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-themes>

For more detail on themes see <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes|https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes>
